unitDisplayFormat.description:
The raw value is stored in bits or bytes. The user interface can display it in these numeral systems:

Binary: 1 MiB = 1024 KiB = 1,048,576 bytes

Decimal: 1 MB = 1000 kB = 1,000,000 bytes

If not set, the decimal system is used.

 [Metric expressions](https://dt-url.net/metricExpression) don't return this field.

 An impact-relevant metric is highly dependent on other metrics and changes because an underlying root-cause metric has changed.

 [Metric expressions](https://dt-url.net/metricExpression) don't return this field.

The latency of the metric, in minutes. 

 The latency is the expected reporting delay (for example, caused by constraints of cloud vendors or other third-party data sources) between the observation of a metric data point and its availability in Dynatrace. 

The allowed value range is from 1 to 60 minutes.

 [Metric expressions](https://dt-url.net/metricExpression) don't return this field.

LogMessageJson.description:
The log message in JSON format. Use one object representing a single event or an array of objects representing multiple events. 

The object might contain the following types of case-insensitive keys (the possible key values are listed below): 

* Timestamp: 
    * The earliest timestamp for a log event is the current time minus 24 hours. If the log event contains a timestamp earlier than the current time minus 24 hours, the event is dropped, and the generic log ingestion API returns a `400` response code. 
    * The latest timestamp for a log event is the current time plus 12 hours. If the log event contains a timestamp later than the current time plus 12 hours, the event is dropped, and the generic log ingestion API returns a `400` response code. 
    * The following formats are supported: UTC milliseconds, RFC3339, and RFC3164. For the missing timestamp, the current timestamp is used. For the unsupported timestamp format, the current timestamp is used, and the value of the unsupported timestamp format is stored in the not indexed `unparsed_timestamp` attribute. 
* Severity. If not set, `NONE` is used. 
* Content. If the content key is not set, the whole JSON is parsed as the content. 
* Semantic attribute. Only values of the `String` type are supported. Semantic attributes are indexed and can be used in queries. These are also displayed in aggregations (facets). If an unsupported key occurs, it is not indexed and can't be used in indexing and aggregations. 

The object value can be a single constant or, in case of semantic attribute, an array of constants. The length of the value is limited. Any content exceeding the limit is trimmed. Default limits:

* Attributes: up to 50 attributes. 
* Content: 8,192 bytes. 
* Semantic attribute: 250 bytes per value, up to 32 attribute values

Supported timestamp keys:
 * @timestamp
 * _timestamp
 * date
 * eventtime
 * published_date
 * syslog.timestamp
 * timestamp

Supported content keys:
 * body
 * content
 * message
 * payload

Supported severity keys:
 * level
 * loglevel
 * severity
 * status
 * syslog.severity

Supported semantic attribute keys:
 * audit.action
 * audit.identity
 * audit.result

id.description: The ActiveGate token identifier, consisting of [prefix and public part](https://dt-url.net/2903ss4) of the token.

expirationDate.description: The token expiration date in ISO 8601 format (`yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'`).

The expiration date of the token. 

You can use one of the following formats: 
* Timestamp in UTC milliseconds. 
* Human-readable format of `2021-01-25T05:57:01.123+01:00`. If no time zone is specified, UTC is used. You can use a space character instead of the `T`. Seconds and fractions of a second are optional. 
* Relative timeframe, back from now. The format is `now-NU/A`, where `N` is the amount of time, `U` is the unit of time, and `A` is an alignment. The alignment rounds all the smaller values to the nearest zero in the past. For example, `now-1y/w` is one year back, aligned by a week. 
You can also specify relative timeframe without an alignment: `now-NU`. 
Supported time units for the relative timeframe are: 
   * `m`: minutes 
   * `h`: hours 
   * `d`: days 
   * `w`: weeks 
   * `M`: months 
   * `y`: years 

If not set, the token never expires.

insertAfter.description:
The position of the new object. The new object will be added after the specified one. 

If `null`, the new object will be placed in the last position. 

If set to empty string, the new object will be placed in the first position. 

Only applicable for objects based on schemas with ordered objects (schema's **ordered** parameter is set to `true`).

schemaVersion.description: The version of the schema on which the object is based.

updateToken.description:
The update token of the object. You can use it to detect simultaneous modifications by different users. 

It is generated upon retrieval (GET requests). If set on update (PUT request) or deletion, the update/deletion will be allowed only if there wasn't any change between the retrieval and the update. 

If omitted on update/deletion, the operation overrides the current value or deletes it without any checks.

insertAfter.description:
The position of the updated object. The new object will be moved behind the specified one. 

**insertAfter** and **insertBefore** are evaluated together and only one of both can be set. 

If `null` and **insertBefore** 'null', the existing object keeps the current position. 

If set to empty string, the updated object will be placed in the first position. 

Only applicable for objects based on schemas with ordered objects (schema's **ordered** parameter is set to `true`).

insertBefore.description:
The position of the updated object. The new object will be moved in front of the specified one. 

**insertAfter** and **insertBefore** are evaluated together and only one of both can be set. 

If `null` and **insertAfter** 'null', the existing object keeps the current position. 

If set to empty string, the updated object will be placed in the last position. 

Only applicable for objects based on schemas with ordered objects (schema's **ordered** parameter is set to `true`).

useRateMetric.description:
The type of the metric to use for SLO calculation: 

* `true`: An existing percentage-based metric. 
* `false`: A ratio of two metrics. 

For a list of available metrics, see [Built-in metric page](https://dt-url.net/be03kow) or try the [GET metrics](https://dt-url.net/8e43kxf) API call.

metricRate.description:
The percentage-based metric for the calculation of the SLO. 

Required when the **useRateMetric** is set to `true`.

metricNumerator.description:
The metric for the count of successes (the numerator in rate calculation). 

Required when the **useRateMetric** is set to `false`.

metricDenominator.description:
The total count metric (the denominator in rate calculation). 

Required when the **useRateMetric** is set to `false`.

 At warning state the SLO is still fulfilled but is getting close to failure.

countryCode.description:
The country code of the location. 

 Use the alpha-2 code of the [ISO 3166-2 standard](https://dt-url.net/iso3166-2), (for example, `AT` for Austria or `PL` for Poland).

regionCode.description:
The region code of the location. 

 For the [USA](https://dt-url.net/iso3166us) or [Canada](https://dt-url.net/iso3166ca) use ISO 3166-2 state codes (without `US-` or `CA-` prefix), for example, `VA` for Virginia or `OR` for Oregon. 

 For the rest of the world use [FIPS 10-4 codes](https://dt-url.net/fipscodes).

latitude.description: The latitude of the location in `DDD.dddd` format.

longitude.description: The longitude of the location in `DDD.dddd` format.

status.description:
The status of the location: 

* `ENABLED`: The location is displayed as active in the UI. You can assign monitors to the location. 
* `DISABLED`: The location is displayed as inactive in the UI. You can't assign monitors to the location. Monitors already assigned to the location will stay there and will be executed from the location. 
* `HIDDEN`: The location is not displayed in the UI. You can't assign monitors to the location. You can only set location as `HIDDEN` when no monitor is assigned to it.

geoLocationId.description: The Dynatrace GeoLocation ID of the location.

SyntheticLocation.description:
Configuration of a synthetic location. 

 **countryCode**, **regionCode**, **city** parameters are optional as they can be retrieved based on **latitude** and **longitude** of location.

 The actual set of fields depends on the type of the location. Find the list of actual objects in the description of the **type** field or see [Synthetic locations API v2 - JSON models](https://dt-url.net/3n43szj).

entityId.description: The Dynatrace entity ID of the location.

cloudPlatform.description:
The cloud provider where the location is hosted. 

 Only applicable to `PUBLIC` locations.

ips.description:
The list of IP addresses assigned to the location. 

 Only applicable to `PUBLIC` locations.

stage.description: The release stage of the location.

geoLocationId.description: The Dynatrace GeoLocation ID of the location.

publicLocationsEnabled.description: Synthetic monitors can (`true`) or can't (`false`) run on public synthetic locations.

SyntheticPublicLocationsStatus.description: The status of public synthetic locations.

type.description:
Defines the actual set of fields depending on the value. See one of the following objects: 

* `PUBLIC` -> SyntheticPublicLocationUpdate 
* `PRIVATE` -> SyntheticPrivateLocationUpdate

SyntheticLocationUpdate.description: The synthetic location update. This is a base object, the exact type depends on the value of the `type` field.

SyntheticPrivateLocationUpdate.description: Configuration of a private synthetic location

nodes.description:
A list of synthetic nodes belonging to the location. 

 You can retrieve the list of available nodes with the [GET all nodes](https://dt-url.net/miy3rpl) call.

 For the rest of the world use [FIPS 10-4 codes](https://dt-url.net/fipscodes).

longitude.description: The longitude of the location in `DDD.dddd` format.

status.description:
The status of the location: 

* `ENABLED`: The location is displayed as active in the UI. You can assign monitors to the location. 
* `DISABLED`: The location is displayed as inactive in the UI. You can't assign monitors to the location. Monitors already assigned to the location will stay there and will be executed from the location. 
* `HIDDEN`: The location is not displayed in the UI. You can't assign monitors to the location. You can only set location as `HIDDEN` when no monitor is assigned to it.

availabilityLocationOutage.description: The alerting of location outage is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`).

availabilityNodeOutage.description:
The alerting of node outage is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`). 

 If enabled, the outage of *any* node in the location triggers an alert.

locationNodeOutageDelayInMinutes.description:
Alert if the location or node outage lasts longer than *X* minutes. 

 Only applicable when **availabilityLocationOutage** or **availabilityNodeOutage** is set to `true`.

availabilityNotificationsEnabled.description: The notifications of location and node outage is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`).

autoUpdateChromium.description: Auto upgrade of Chromium is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`).

deploymentType.description:
The deployment type of the location: 

* `STANDARD`: The location is deployed on Windows or Linux.
* `KUBERNETES`: The location is deployed on Kubernetes.

SyntheticPublicLocationUpdate.description: The update of a public Synthetic location.

Configuration of a synthetic node. 

 A *synthetic node* is an ActiveGate that is able to execute synthetic monitors.

oneAgentRoutingEnabled.description: The Active Gate has the One Agent routing enabled ('true') or not ('false').

status.description: The status of the synthetic node.

playerVersion.description: The version of the synthetic player.

healthCheckStatus.description: The health check status of the synthetic node.

NodeCollectionElement.description: The short representation of a synthetic object. Only contains the ID and the display name.

batchId.description: The batch identifier of the triggered executions.

triggeringProblemsCount.description: The total number of problems within the batch.

triggeringProblemsDetails.description: List with the entities for which triggering problems occurred.

triggeredCount.description: The total number of the triggered executions within the batch.

triggered.description: Monitors for which on-demand executions were triggered.

locationId.description: The identifier of the location from which the monitor is to be executed.

cause.description: The cause of not triggering entity.

SyntheticOnDemandTriggeringProblemDetail.description: Contains the details of problems encountered while triggering on-demand executions.

failOnPerformanceIssue.description: If true, the status will be FAILED in case of performance issue.

stopOnProblem.description: If true, no executions will be scheduled if a problem occurs.

monitors.description: List of monitors to be triggered.

SyntheticOnDemandExecutionRequest.description: Contains parameters for the on-demand execution of monitors identified by tags, applications, or services.

tags.description: List of tags. Only monitors with all tags assigned will be executed.

items.description: List of tags. Only monitors with all tags assigned will be executed.

applications.description: List of application identifiers. Only monitors with all applications assigned will be executed.

items.description: List of application identifiers. Only monitors with all applications assigned will be executed.

services.description: List of service identifiers. Only monitors with all services assigned will be executed.

items.description: List of service identifiers. Only monitors with all services assigned will be executed.

locations.description: The locations from where monitors are to be executed.

items.description: The locations from where monitors are to be executed.

SyntheticOnDemandExecutionRequestGroup.description: Contains parameters for the on-demand execution of monitors identified by tags, applications, or services.

locations.description: The locations from where the monitor is to be executed.

items.description: The locations from where the monitor is to be executed.

SyntheticOnDemandExecutionRequestMonitor.description: Contains monitors to be executed on demand from the locations specified.

userId.description: The name of the user who triggered execution of the batch.

triggeredCount.description: The number of triggered executions within the batch.

executedCount.description: The number of triggered executions with the result SUCCESS or FAILED.

failedCount.description: The number of triggered executions with the result FAILED.

failedToExecuteCount.description: The number of executions that were triggered and timed out because of a problem with the Synthetic engine.

triggeringProblemsCount.description: The number of executions that were not triggered due to some problems.

SyntheticOnDemandBatchStatus.description: Contains information about on-demand executions triggered within the batch.

executionTimestamp.description: The timestamp when execution was finished, in UTC milliseconds.

locationId.description: The identifier of the location from where the monitor is to be executed.

SyntheticOnDemandFailedExecutionStatus.description: Contains information about on-demand executions that failed or failed to be executed.

BMAction.description: Contains detailed information about Browser monitor action.

domain.description: The DNS domain where the action has been recorded

startTime.description: The start time of the action on the server, in in UTC milliseconds.

endTime.description: The stop time of the action on the server, in UTC milliseconds

duration.description: The duration of the action, in milliseconds

apdexType.description: The user experience index of the action.

speedIndex.description: A score indicating how quickly the page content is visually populated. A low speed index means that most parts of a page are rendering quickly.

networkTime.description: The amount of time spent on the data transfer for the action, in milliseconds.

serverTime.description: The amount of time spent on the server-side processing for the action, in milliseconds.

frontendTime.description: The amount of time spent on the frontend rendering for the action, in milliseconds.

documentInteractiveTime.description: The amount of time spent until the document for the action became interactive, in milliseconds.

thirdPartyResources.description: The number of third party resources loaded for the action.

thirdPartyBusyTime.description: The time spent waiting for third party resources for the action, in milliseconds.

cdnResources.description: The number of resources fetched from a CDN for the action.

cdnBusyTime.description: The time spent waiting for CDN resources for the action, in milliseconds.

firstPartyResources.description: The number of resources fetched from the originating server for the action.

firstPartyBusyTime.description: The time spent waiting for resources from the originating server for the action, in milliseconds.

domCompleteTime.description: The amount of time until the DOM tree is completed, in milliseconds.

domContentLoadedTime.description: The amount of time until the DOM tree is loaded, in milliseconds.

loadEventStart.description: The amount of time until the load event started, in milliseconds.

loadEventEnd.description: The amount of time until the load event ended, in milliseconds.

navigationStartTime.description: The timestamp of the navigation start, in UTC milliseconds.

requestStart.description: The amount of time until the request started, in milliseconds.

responseStart.description: The amount of time until the response started, in milliseconds.

responseEnd.description: The amount of time until the response ended, in milliseconds.

visuallyCompleteTime.description: The amount of time until the page is visually complete, in milliseconds.

startSequenceNumber.description: The sequence number of the action (to get a kind of order).

clientTime.description: The event startTime in client time, in milliseconds.

userActionPropertyCount.description: The total number of properties in the action.

customErrorCount.description: The total number of custom errors during the action.

javascriptErrorCount.description: The total number of Javascript errors during the action.

requestErrorCount.description: The total number of request errors during the action.

largestContentfulPaint.description: The largest contentful paint (LCP) is the time (in milliseconds) that the largest element on the page took to render.

firstInputDelay.description: The first input delay (FID) is the time (in milliseconds) that the browser took to respond to the first user input.

cumulativeLayoutShift.description: Cumulative layout shift: Available for Chromium-based browsers. Measured using Google-provided APIs.

totalBlockingTime.description: The time between the moment when the browser receives a request to download a resource and the time that it actually starts downloading the resource in ms.

executionSteps.description: Details about the monitor's step execution.

executedSteps.description: Number of the executed steps by Synthetic engine

engineId.description: Synthetic engine id on which monitor was executed.

publicLocation.description: Flag informs whether request was executed on public location.

responseBodySizeLimitExceeded.description: A flag indicating that the response payload size limit of 10MB has been exceeded.

peerCertificateExpiryDate.description: An expiry date of the first SSL certificate from the certificate chain.

totalTime.description: A total time measured in milliseconds.

hostNameResolutionTime.description: A hostname resolution time measured in milliseconds.

tcpConnectTime.description: A TCP connect time measured in milliseconds.

tlsHandshakeTime.description: A TLS handshake time measured in milliseconds.

timeToFirstByte.description: A time to first byte measured in milliseconds.

redirectionTime.description: Total number of milliseconds spent on handling all redirect requests, measured in milliseconds.

Api-Token.description:
Dynatrace API Token

 The token is passed in the **Authorization** header in the following format: `Authorization: Api-Token abcdefjhij1234567890`.
Api-Token.name: Authorization
